body_html:
Please send a PR!
…
On Aug 12, 2017 6:24 AM, "nolan liu" ***@***.***> wrote: @alextp <https://github.com/alextp> System information - *Code* embedding_lookup_sparse <https://gist.github.com/nolanliou/c00af5938b2aecfdc5ea1189426b8624> - *Params* 100M * 1K - *Id* 256 * 1000 - *CPU* 32-cores - *Tensorflow* r1.3 Conclusion On a single machine, profiling the embedding_lookup_sparse with tfprof, the result shows that gather Op takes a lot of time. I checked the code and found that the CPU version gather op is single-thread. Then I modify the gather Op to multi-threads, the result shows about 6x speedup, which benifites a lot of cases. If neccessary, I can post a PR. Profiling result node name | requested bytes | total execution time | accelerator execution t ime | cpu execution time` # old `gather` Gather 2048.00MB (100.00%, 2.27%), 622.96ms (99.99%, 22.97%), 0us (0.00%, 0.00%), 622.96ms (99.99%, 22.97%) # multi-thread `gather` Gather 2048.00MB (100.00%, 49.96%), 107.91ms (99.99%, 5.50%), 0us (0.00%, 0.00%), 107.91ms (99.99%, 5.50%) — You are receiving this because you were mentioned. Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub <#11709 (comment)>, or mute the thread <https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/AAATxbWYcp_2ZsE-T5iTNVSBOCA_d7fhks5sXaefgaJpZM4Og3Qr> .
body_text:
Please send a PR!
…
On Aug 12, 2017 6:24 AM, "nolan liu" ***@***.***> wrote:
 @alextp <https://github.com/alextp>
 System information

    - *Code*
    embedding_lookup_sparse
    <https://gist.github.com/nolanliou/c00af5938b2aecfdc5ea1189426b8624>
    - *Params*
    100M * 1K
    - *Id*
    256 * 1000
    - *CPU*
    32-cores
    - *Tensorflow*
    r1.3

 Conclusion

 On a single machine, profiling the embedding_lookup_sparse with tfprof,
 the result shows that gather Op takes a lot of time. I checked the code
 and found that the CPU version gather op is single-thread.
 Then I modify the gather Op to multi-threads, the result shows about 6x
 speedup, which benifites a lot of cases. If neccessary, I can post a PR.
 Profiling result

 node name | requested bytes | total execution time | accelerator execution t    ime | cpu execution time`
 # old `gather`
 Gather     2048.00MB (100.00%, 2.27%),   622.96ms (99.99%, 22.97%),    0us (0.00%, 0.00%),  622.96ms (99.99%, 22.97%)
 # multi-thread `gather`
 Gather    2048.00MB (100.00%, 49.96%),   107.91ms (99.99%, 5.50%),     0us (0.00%, 0.00%),   107.91ms (99.99%, 5.50%)

 —
 You are receiving this because you were mentioned.
 Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub
 <#11709 (comment)>,
 or mute the thread
 <https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/AAATxbWYcp_2ZsE-T5iTNVSBOCA_d7fhks5sXaefgaJpZM4Og3Qr>
 .
body:
Please send a PR!

On Aug 12, 2017 6:24 AM, "nolan liu" <notifications@github.com> wrote:

> @alextp <https://github.com/alextp>
> System information
>
>    - *Code*
>    embedding_lookup_sparse
>    <https://gist.github.com/nolanliou/c00af5938b2aecfdc5ea1189426b8624>
>    - *Params*
>    100M * 1K
>    - *Id*
>    256 * 1000
>    - *CPU*
>    32-cores
>    - *Tensorflow*
>    r1.3
>
> Conclusion
>
> On a single machine, profiling the embedding_lookup_sparse with tfprof,
> the result shows that gather Op takes a lot of time. I checked the code
> and found that the CPU version gather op is single-thread.
> Then I modify the gather Op to multi-threads, the result shows about 6x
> speedup, which benifites a lot of cases. If neccessary, I can post a PR.
> Profiling result
>
> node name | requested bytes | total execution time | accelerator execution t    ime | cpu execution time`
> # old `gather`
> Gather     2048.00MB (100.00%, 2.27%),   622.96ms (99.99%, 22.97%),    0us (0.00%, 0.00%),  622.96ms (99.99%, 22.97%)
> # multi-thread `gather`
> Gather    2048.00MB (100.00%, 49.96%),   107.91ms (99.99%, 5.50%),     0us (0.00%, 0.00%),   107.91ms (99.99%, 5.50%)
>
> —
> You are receiving this because you were mentioned.
> Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub
> <https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/issues/11709#issuecomment-321980774>,
> or mute the thread
> <https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/AAATxbWYcp_2ZsE-T5iTNVSBOCA_d7fhks5sXaefgaJpZM4Og3Qr>
